episodes.title: The Untold Reality of Growing Up Gay as a Member of the Jehovah's Witness Cult
episodes.description:
Sid is a recovering ex Jehovah's Witness, who was born in and raised in the Cult. She is motivated to help others who have been victimized by this cruel narcissistic cult by sharing her story and experiences. Also covering topics on self improvement, mental & physical health.


ardis.1979@yahoo.com

episodes.title: When Faith In The Jehovah's Witness Cult Costs You Your Children
episodes.description: Sid is a recovering ex Jehovah's Witness, who was born in and raised in the Cult. She is motivated to help others who have been victimized by this cruel narcissistic cult by sharing her story and experiences. Also covering topics on self improvement, mental & physical health.

episodes.title: Yet another Jehovah's Witness Elder CONVICTED of sexually assaulting children, along with 5 others.
episodes.description:
Norman Aviles-Garriga, 45, of Lancaster, was among five members of the Jehovah’s Witness church in Pennsylvania indicted by a state grand jury for using their clerical positions to sexually abuse children. He was convicted on charges of aggravated indecent assault, indecent assault and endangering the welfare of children.

Article:
https://lancasteronline.com/news/local/lancaster-jehovah-s-witness-elder-sentenced-to-prison-for-molesting-congregant-children/article_a8f478b8-9311-11ef-ba0e-9f2e33644e4a.html

episodes.title: 🧿Take out the trash/spiritual warfare/protect yourself 🪽
🧿How being a Jehovah's Witness kid made me want to un-alive myself, and how I got through it.
episodes.description:
This topic may trigger some, but it's something that needs to be exposed. I feel way too many young people who are trapped against their will in the Jehovah's Witness Cult have these feelings of wanting to un-alive themselves, because they are being forced to participate in a lifestyle that they don't want.

https://youtu.be/Li6vpAMmfw0?si=0pVTuLH5zUwwSXS9

The National Suicide Prevention Lifeline offers services to talk to a skilled counselor. If you are feeling distressed and need to talk to a counselor, please call 1-800-273-TALK (8255). If you prefer to chat to a counselor online, the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline offers that service.
